USA: Standard Oil Company v. United States: The Supreme Court found Standard Oil guilty of monopolizing the petroleum industry; subsequently dividing Standard Oil into several geographically separate firms.
The first Indianapolis 500 was held; being won by Ray Harroun.
Philippine: Mt Taal erupts, and kills 1,334 people
De La Salle University-Manila is founded as De La Salle College by the Brothers of Christian Schools.
Tricentennial of the Royal and Pontifical University of Santo Tomas
Italy: Italy defeats the Ottoman Empire and gain control over Libya and the Rhodes archipelago.
Indonesia: Tirto Adhi Suryo founds the Islamic Traders' League.
India: British government change capital city from Calcutta to Delhi.
Haiti: President Antoine Simon cedes the presidency to Cincinnatus Leconte
Germany: Agadir Crisis: The German gunboat SMS Panther arrived at the Moroccan port of Agadir.
Cyprus: Sir Hamilton Goold-Adams became Crown commissioner.
China: Wuchang uprising: New Army soldiers staged a mutiny in Wuchang District and occupied the residence of the Viceroy of Huguang.

Republic of China provisional presidential election, 1911: Sun Yat-sen was elected president of the Provisional Government of the Republic of China, with a majority of sixteen of the seventeen provincial representatives of the Tongmenghui in Nanjing.
Brazil: The cargo ship Nubia SS runs aground off the coast of Rio Grande do Norte.
Belgium: Maurice Maeterlinck awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature
Australia: The Royal Australian Navy is founded
The Northern Territory comes under Commonwealth control, being split off from South Australia
The first national census is conducted.
Albania: Albanian Highlanders under Ded Gjo Luli defeated Ottoman forces in the town of Tuzi.
